title: Pruining while in execution stage
body:
Hello,

I have a question, I started syncing again my node and this time I wanted to change the prune parameters while I reached 10m block execution.

So I changed the following flags:

` --prune.h.before 70000 --prune.r.before 70000 --prune.t.before 70000 --prune.c.before 70000`

to these:

` --prune.h.before 10000000--prune.r.before 10000000--prune.t.before 10000000--prune.c.before 10000000`

But no effect was seen so far, do I need to do something else for the new parameters to be considered?

_The node is eating space like cake is eaten at my birthday._

@perfectcircle2020 
1. `10000000--prune.c.before` you lost space
2. We do prohibitÂ changing prune settings - because it's very easy to do "human mistakes" here, and likely it will not do what you expect. 
3. Please read `--prune.*.older` and `--prune.*.before` flags difference in `erigon --help`
4. Describe your use-case - why default --prune settings do not work for you? Is this what you looking for: https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon#beacon-chain ?
5. "The node is eating space like cake is eaten at my birthday." - please avoid non-measurable sentences. It's impossible to extract any valuable information from such sentences, but they may touch people's emotions. 
Thank you.

@AskAlexSharov 

Thank you for the reply.

1. I am aware of that, It was a mistake while copying and pasting.
2. I understand, I would like to prune block bodies, to free some space :)
3. I want to save up space in the same manner `--prune=hrtc` saved in previuos sync attempts, while now save even more space by keeping only the last blocks, Is it possible given the circumstances?


Thank you
@perfectcircle2020 yes, Please read --prune.*.older and --prune.*.before flags description in erigon --help. likely you wanna use another `older` flag.

@AskAlexSharov  Thanks

I came up with the following parameters:
`--prune.h.older=50000  --prune.r.older=50000 --prune.t.older=50000 --prune.c.older=50000 --prune.h.before=0 --prune.r.before=0 --prune.t.before=0 --prune.c.before=0`

Is it correct this way the node will keep only the last 50K blocks? 

Thanks

1. if you set `--prune.h.older` then no reason to set `--prune.h.before`. 
2. `--prune.h.before=0` - means "delete data before block 0" - means "don't delete anything".
3. default `--prune` parameter is shortcut for `--prune.h.older=90_000 --prune.r.older=90_000 --prune.t.older=90_000 --prune.c.older=90_000`. so, probably just add one flag `--prune` (without any other prune flags) is good enough for you.

@AskAlexSharov Thank you for the clarification. 

I am now using  only the older prune flags, but still the occupied space is increasing very fast, I am worried I will run out of space before the node will be fully synced. 

I mean the flags seem not trigger the start of the pruining process

Is it expected behavoir?, or do I need to perform some other actions in order for the prune operation to take place?

PS: I am syncing BSC

Thank you

Can't advise if you don't show for me details:
- "now using only the older prune flags" - don't describe it by words, just past cli flags here. 
- "increasing very fast" - don't describe it by words, just show `du -h` and current erigon logs, and say what size do you expect.

Ncdu:
![immagine](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/88373598/157807247-84c172cc-5a17-42bc-8a3c-94b9d7217954.png)

While I was syncing from scrath with `--prune=hrtc` the size of the database wouldn't be higher than 1.4 TB.

Now that I am using these: 

`./erigonv1 --chain bsc --datadir bsc-mainnet --prune.h.older=90000  --prune.r.older=90000 --prune.t.older=90000 --prune.c.older=90000`

The space occupied is like in the image.

Thank you
show logs of erigon when it starts - it does print which flags it using
![immagine](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/88373598/157808363-4a33dd25-f194-481e-8ef7-30b522ef0f87.png)
see "Effective" line. It shows `--prune=` it means pruning is disabled. likely you need add flag `--prune` to enable it - even if you configure all other --prune.* flags
Thank you!!!
I also didn't know about it

![immagine](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/88373598/157808695-cd8837da-cfd4-4e7e-a316-971574cb3234.png)

Error: Fatal: error while parsing mode: unexpected flag found: -
I just tested `--prune=hrtc --prune.r.older=123` works
Thank you!!

I pulled newest version from github and compiled and started again it says that:

![immagine](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/88373598/157809427-6e97be55-4010-497c-878b-4770162385dc.png)
some database format change migration

@AskAlexSharov Unfortunatelly after the migration I still get:

`EROR[03-12|15:51:11.219] Erigon startup                           err="not allowed change of --prune flag, last time you used: --prune="  `

And have even more space occupied

![immagine](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/88373598/158022826-a1c4f8a3-3062-4127-8024-5d419e1a69b2.png)

I am using this command to start the node: 

`./erigon_latest --chain bsc --datadir bsc-mainnet --prune=hrtc --prune.h.older=90000  --prune.r.older=90000 --prune.t.older=90000 --prune.c.older=90000 `

Already told you: 
`We do prohibit changing prune settings - because it's very easy to do "human mistakes" here, and likely it will not do what you expect.`
We have tool to force change prune flag, but we don't recommend to use it - because it will not do what you expect and can lead to problems  
I advise you re-sync with right set of flags.

Hello @AskAlexSharov , I started syncing my node and when it got to block execution stage I ran out of space. Now I wanted to add prune flags but I get this message `not allowed change of --prune flag, last time you used`.

2 questions:

- is there a way I can resync with the correct prune flags without having to download the snapshots again?
- what are the correct prune flags for staking?

1 request:

Can you please add a section about pruning in the project readme? Especially since one can not change the prune flags later (it would save users some wasted time).  Also I guess there is a section about prune flags for the beacon chain:

> Erigon can be used as an execution-layer for beacon chain consensus clients (Eth2). Default configuration is ok. Eth2 relies on availability of receipts - don't prune them: don't add character r to --prune flag. However, old receipts are not needed for Eth2 and you can safely prune them with --prune.r.before=11184524 in combination with --prune htc.

Should I deduce from this that the correct flags for staking are `--prune htc`? Maybe state it more directly?
I removed the `chaindata` folder but kept the `snapshots` folder and now it started ok, went straight into `[1/16 Headers] Inserting headers` ðð»
